Appearance
From Wiktionary, the free dictionary
See also: Salam, salám, sālām, salām, sāļam, sāļām, šálám, and sálám

English

[edit]

Interjection

[edit]

salam

  1. Alternative spelling of salaam.

Noun

[edit]

salam (plural salams)

  1. Alternative spelling of salaam.

Verb

[edit]

salam (third-person singular simple present salams, present participle salaming, simple past and past participle salamed)

  1. Alternative spelling of salaam.

Anagrams

[edit]
  • Alams, Lamas, Salma, Slama, almas, amlas, laams, lamas, malas

Atong (India)

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

From Arabic سَلَام (salām).

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): /sʰalam/

Interjection

[edit]

salam (Bengali script সালাম)

  1. hello

References

[edit]
  • van Breugel, Seino. 2015. Atong-English dictionary, second edition. Available online: https://www.academia.edu/487044/Atong_English_Dictionary.

Azerbaijani

[edit]
Azerbaijani phrasebook
This entry is part of the phrasebook project, which presents criteria for inclusion based on utility, simplicity and commonness.

Etymology

[edit]

Inherited from Old Anatolian Turkish سلام (selām), from Arabic سَلَام (salām).

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • Audio:(file)

Interjection

[edit]

salam

  1. hello
    - Salam! -Əleyküm salam!
    - Hello! - Hello to you, too!

Eastern Cham

[edit]

Alternative forms

[edit]
  • ꨦꨤꩌ

Etymology

[edit]

From Arabic سَلَام (salām, “peace; hello”).

Interjection

[edit]

salam

  1. hello

Indonesian

[edit]

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): /ˈsalam/
  • Hyphenation: sa‧lam
  • Rhymes: -lam, -am, -m

Etymology 1

[edit]

From Malay salam, from Classical Malay salam, from Arabic سَلَام (salām, “peace”). Doublet of salim and syalom.

Noun

[edit]

salam

  1. peace
  2. (Islam) salaam alaikum (Muslim greeting)
  3. greeting
    Synonym: tabik
Derived terms
[edit]
  • bersalam
  • bersalam-salaman
  • bersalaman
  • menyalam
  • menyalami
  • persalaman
  • salam hormat
  • salam kepal tangan
  • salam takzim
  • salam tempel

Etymology 2

[edit]

From Malay salam (“Malabar plum, Java plum”), from Classical Malay salam, from Tamil சாலம் (cālam, “tree”), from Sanskrit शाल (śāla). Doublet of sala and syala.

  • Semantic loan from Javanese salam (ꦱꦭꦩ꧀, “Indian bay leaf”).

Noun

[edit]

salam

  1. indian bay leaf (Syzygium polyanthum)
  2. (rare) Malabar plum, Java plum (Syzygium cumini)
    Synonyms: duwet, jamblang, jambu keling

Etymology 3

[edit]

From Arabic سَلَم (salam, “futures contract, time bargain, forward transaction”).

Noun

[edit]

salam

  1. (Islamic finance) futures contract
    Synonym: kontrak berjangka

Further reading

[edit]
  • “salam”, in Kamus Besar Bahasa Indonesia [Great Dictionary of the Indonesian Language] (in Indonesian), Jakarta: Agency for Language Development and Cultivation – Ministry of Education, Culture, Research, and Technology of the Republic of Indonesia, 2016

Latvian

[edit]

Noun

[edit]

salam m

  1. dative singular of sals

Mauritian Creole

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

From Hindi सलाम (salām, “hello”), from Arabic سَلَام (salām, “peace; hello”).

Interjection

[edit]

salam

  1. A greeting.

See also

[edit]
  • sali

Piedmontese

[edit]

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): /saˈlam/

Noun

[edit]

salam m

  1. salami

Romanian

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

Ultimately from Italian salame.

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): /sa.ˈlam/
  • Rhymes: -am
  • Hyphenation: sa‧lam

Noun

[edit]

salam n (plural salamuri)

  1. salami

Declension

[edit]
singular plural
indefinite definite indefinite definite
nominative-accusative salam salamul salamuri salamurile
genitive-dative salam salamului salamuri salamurilor
vocative salamule salamurilor

Further reading

[edit]
  • “salam”, in DEX online—Dicționare ale limbii române (Dictionaries of the Romanian language) (in Romanian), 2004–2025

Turkish

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

From Italian salame.

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): [salám]
  • Hyphenation: sa‧lam

Noun

[edit]

salam (definite accusative salamı, plural salamlar)

  1. salami

Declension

[edit]
Declension of salam
singular plural
nominative salam salamlar
definite accusative salamı salamları
dative salama salamlara
locative salamda salamlarda
ablative salamdan salamlardan
genitive salamın salamların

Yakan

[edit]

Verb

[edit]

salam

  1. to salute someone
